How to Use Functions in TextAnalysisR

Source: R/text_mining_functions.R
how_to_use.Rd

This documentation provides guidance on how to use a set of functions related to:

  • Word-topic probabilities (Beta)

  • Document-topic probabilities (Gamma)

  • Estimated effects of covariates on topic prevalence

  • Network analysis

These steps are similar to those demonstrated in the Shiny web app at TextAnalysisR::TextAnalysisR.app().

Usage

how_to_use()

Value

No return value, called for documentation purposes only.

Word-Topic Probabilities (Beta)

  1. Fit an STM model using stm::stm().

  2. Extract the beta matrix as a tidy data frame with tidytext::tidy(stm_model, matrix = "beta").

  3. Use examine_top_terms to find top words in each topic.

  4. Use plot_topic_term to visualize top terms per topic.

Document-Topic Probabilities (Gamma)

  1. Extract gamma from tidytext::tidy(stm_model, matrix = "gamma").

  2. Use topic_probability_plot to visualize topic prevalence.

  3. Use topic_probability_table to obtain a table of top topics.

Estimated Effects (Categorical and Continuous Variables)

  1. Use stm::estimateEffect() to model how covariates predict topic proportions.

  2. Extract effects using stminsights::get_effects() and visualize them with custom plotting functions.

Network Analysis

  1. Hierarchical Clustering: Use textmineR::CalcHellingerDist() on stm_model$theta, then hclust() and ggdendro::ggdendrogram() to visualize.

  2. Text Network: Convert the dfm to a tidy format, use widyr::pairwise_cor(), filter by correlation, and visualize with igraph + ggraph.

  3. Term Frequency Over Time: Merge dfm counts with document-level variables, group by a continuous variable, and plot changes in term frequency over time with ggplot2.

Examples

# This section provides general guidance; no direct runnable code is required.
